slides.title: Types of Numbers
slides.content:
**Natural Numbers:** 1, 2, 3, 4...
**Whole Numbers:** 0, 1, 2, 3...
**Integers:** ...-2, -1, 0, 1, 2...
**Prime Numbers:** Divisible by 1 and itself only (2, 3, 5, 7, 11...)
**Composite:** Non-prime (4, 6, 8, 9...)
**Even/Odd:** Divisible by 2 / Not divisible by 2

slides.title: Divisibility Rules
slides.content:
**2:** Last digit even
**3:** Sum of digits divisible by 3
**5:** Last digit 0 or 5
**10:** Last digit 0
**11:** Difference of alternate digit sums divisible by 11

slides.title: HCF and LCM
slides.content:
**HCF (Highest Common Factor):** Largest number dividing all
**LCM (Lowest Common Multiple):** Smallest number divisible by all
**Property:** HCF Ã— LCM = Product of numbers

question.questionText: Which of the following is a prime number?
question.explanation: 17 is a prime number as it is only divisible by 1 and 17. All other options have more divisors.
